The claim is made by Tina Freitas: a GOP activist and challenger to State Sen. Emmett Hanger in a Republican primary.
The claim states that Hanger has voted f: proposed tax increases - in Virginia history.
The expert fact: checked the claim by examining the votes and bills mentioned by Freitas.
The expert found that Hanger did vote fo: 1 billion annual tax increase proposed in 2006, but he opposed and did not vote for the transportation tax package passed in 2013. The expert also found that Hanger voted for a procedural vote to allow the chambers to work out a compromise on the transportation tax package, but ultimately voted against the compromise. Additionally, Hanger did not vote for the successful $700 million tax increase proposed in 2004.
